meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your boy here to dish out some thoughts on Little Goody Two Shoes. Now, I know what you're thinking: another reviewer trying to sound clever with anime references and "wickedly creative" this and that. But trust me, I'm not just whistling Dixie here (see what I did there?). This game has got it going on!

So, let's get down to business. Little Goody Two Shoes is a wild ride, folks. It's like a rollercoaster of genres: dating sim, graphic adventure, role-playing game... and then some! But in the best way possible, you know? Imagine playing a choose-your-own-adventure book from back in the day (I mean, who didn't love those things?) and then suddenly it turns into a resource management game, only to become a social simulation, all while keeping a pulse-pounding horror vibe going! That's this game in a nutshell. Well, more like a piñata full of surprises!

Now, I know some of the big-name critics have already weighed in (RPG Fan, Attack of the Fanboy, and friends), so let me just say that they're not wrong... but neither are they entirely right, if you catch my drift! See, everyone seems to be singing the praises of Little Goody Two Shoes' art style, which is fair enough – it's straight-up gorgeous! But what really gets me excited is how this game manages to balance its many moving parts. I mean, we're talking multiple genres, multiple endings... and did I mention there are mini-games?! It's like the Astral Shift team took every good idea they had and said, "Hey, why not?! Let's put 'em all together!"

And don't even get me started on Elise! That little snotty kid (I mean, come on, she's got spunk!) – you just want to root for her as she navigates this crazy world. Heck, I almost felt bad when things got real spooky!

All right, enough gushing (for now). If you're looking for a game that's all over the place (in the best way possible), then Little Goody Two Shoes is your jam! Just don't say I didn't warn you... it can get a little crazy up in here!
